John Berlin.Action: Shares openly about his struggles with alcoholism and loss, thanks the group sincerely.
Initially didn't intend to speak or come to the meeting, showing hesitation.
Speaks openly and honestly at a meeting about his struggles and progress with alcoholism, showing self-awareness and determination to change.
Initially did not intend to speak or even come to the meeting, indicating some hesitation or lack of confidence at first.
Acknowledges frustration when gas is out and tries to fix the problem despite adversity.
Eats minimal and unappetizing food, suggesting indifference or neglect to self-care.
Smokes a cigarette with 'cruel hit full of nicotine and guilt,' indicating personal struggle and possible self-awareness.
Clearly recognizes the voice on the scanner and engages with the Controller to coordinate securing the location.
Advises to 'roll a couple of cars' and 'secure the location' despite lacking ETA information, showing initiative and command.
Arrives at the crime scene and reports that an old man offed himself with a knife, though he cannot find the knife.
Offers to help look for the knife despite being new and not official yet.
Uses somewhat sarcastic tone calling himself a 'tourist' when questioned about his authority.
Answers questions calmly and explains observations sincerely, showing professional patience with the reporter.
Wears surgical gloves and handles the camera film carefully, ready to assist in the investigation.
Provides an insightful analysis of the wound pattern to suggest hesitation cuts typical of suicide attempts, impressing a local reporter.
Admits to not having started proper work yet, calling himself a 'tourist' and deferring tasks to others.
Lands a friendly grin when Blattis leaves, engaging in light conversation about barbecues and fishing.
Takes time to examine the evidence carefully and cooperatively, handing the flashlight back politely.
Reassures Ross with a nearly smiling comment, 'It's good to be with you, Ross.'
Responds bluntly to coroner question, 'Yeah, he can go ...' without elaboration.
Organizes and continues an exhaustive grid-search in terrible weather conditions, showing commitment and methodical approach to the investigation.
Responds assertively to release a derelict when asked by the coroner, showing decisiveness.
Engages in some light humor/banter with Ross, maintaining morale despite the tough situation.
Refers to Freddy as a longtime buddy, speaks casually about their relationship.
Asks Travis to help carry equipment from his car.
Uses a security code at the door, showing familiarity with the station.
Maintains casual and easy rapport with Blattis, confidently discussing relationships and work history.
Delegates tasks effectively by asking Travis to bring in the rest of the equipment from his car.
Admits they have not found the knife but indicates they have developed a theory.
Suggests the kid might be lying to Blattis, showing skepticism and directness.
Engages casually with colleagues, answering the phone 'Hey, Ronzo, good of you to call.'
Uses friendly nicknames and expresses appreciation on phone, calling Ronny 'my favourite man' and congratulating him sincerely.
Engages professionally and attentively in morgue autopsy details, showing interest and focus on the victim’s condition.
Accepts compliments warmly from Margie Ross and shares friendly greetings with enthusiasm ('explosion of hugs').
Chews gum while engaging in work-related tasks, appears focused and calm but not particularly engaging others beyond necessary interaction.
Asks Ross for clarification on a comment, indicating some open communication but no emotional depth shown.
Considers condition of severed hand and plans to try to get a print if it's usable.
Remembers a relevant question about the 'frozen' hand and raises it for clarification.
Engages in light social behavior (chewing gum) while continuing professional activity (observing pathology details).
Declines champagne politely, citing diet and accepts diet soda offered by Margie.
Replies shortly and somewhat dismissively about his new residence with 'O.K.' and 'Not too good in daylight.'
Smiles when asked a casual question by Venables, engages in light conversation.

Shows focused attention on the investigation, ignoring distractions (vacuum cleaner).
Shows determination and self-discipline by gradually quitting smoking using a ritual method.
Engages in a casual, straightforward conversation with Ross without hostility.
Uses a Zippo with L.A.P.D. insignia, implying pride or identification with his profession.
Does not dismiss Ross's advice outright, shows openness.
Checks on the Jennifer case despite it being considered a dead end by others, confirms information independently by checking with Taylor.
Uses a deliberate, stepwise method to quit smoking by gradually reducing cigarette consumption rather than quitting abruptly.
Seems skeptical or dismissive about Ross's advice on personal matters (quitting smoking via distraction), showing independence in judgment.
Destroys cigarettes in an ashtray and proceeds with a disciplined plan, showing self-control and adherence to a method.

Expresses defeat ('I'm fucked') and seeks oxygen after physical exertion, indicating physical limitations.
Expresses visible misgivings as he handles the exhumation and identification of Jennifer.

Provides detailed forensic information about the blood evidence, noting its rarity and compatibility carefully.

Recognizes similarities between cases and suggests they may be connected.
Provides four points of positive comparison on the cut, showing attention to detail.

Engages in dialogue with Citrine without confrontation; shows willingness to listen and talk.
Drives with festering eyes, worries silently and obsessively about the case.
Responds skeptically to Ross about a theory, showing critical but not dismissive attitude.
Engages in candid, somewhat rough conversation but shows concern and interest in Ross's welfare, demonstrating an underlying friendly rapport.

Uses coarse language and seems a bit brusque, potentially alienating, but not necessarily unfriendly or insincere.
Persistently follows up on leads for the missing person case, showing hope and attention to detail.
Focuses intensely on work and notes, showing limited interaction with others present.

Organizes information systematically on a legal pad, actively follows promising leads during phone calls, quickly discards irrelevant calls to focus on more relevant ones, and engages others efficiently in the investigation.

Accepts silences and lack of definite answers without showing frustration, indicating emotional control and tact.

Decides to stop at the diner after initially not planning to, showing flexibility and reassessment of choices.
